name: Inhaled Poison
description: Poisonous powders and gases that take effect when inhaled, affecting nasal membranes, tear ducts, and other body parts
trigger: Being within the poison's area of effect when powder is blown or gas released

application.duration: Cloud dissipates immediately after initial effect
application.special: Holding breath is ineffective - affects nasal membranes, tear ducts, and other body parts

samplePoisons.name: Burnt Othur Fumes
samplePoisons.damage: 10 (3d6) Poison damage initially, then 3 (1d6) per turn
samplePoisons.effect: Repeats save at start of each turn. On failure: 3 (1d6) damage. After 3 successful saves: poison ends

samplePoisons.name: Essence of Ether
samplePoisons.effect: Poisoned condition for 8 hours. Also Unconscious while Poisoned. Wakes if damaged or shaken awake (action)

samplePoisons.name: Malice
samplePoisons.effect: Poisoned condition for 1 hour. Also Blinded while Poisoned

ongoing: Burnt Othur Fumes: Recurring damage requiring repeated saves
Essence of Ether: Extended unconsciousness for 8 hours
Malice: Blinded for full hour duration

detection.method: Wisdom (Perception) to notice container/mechanism, see cloud forming, or smell gas

mitigation: Avoid entering the 5-foot Cube area of effect
Stay upwind of potential gas sources
Use air-filtering mask or similar protection (GM discretion)
Have Resistance or Immunity to Poison damage
Use Protection from Poison spell (Advantage on saves, Resistance to damage)
Cast Gust of Wind or similar magic to disperse gas before it affects area
For Essence of Ether: Ally can shake unconscious victim awake (action)
Note: Holding breath does NOT work - poison affects external membranes
tacticalConsiderations: Affects all creatures in 5-foot Cube simultaneously
Cannot be avoided by holding breath
Excellent for ambushes in enclosed spaces
Burnt Othur Fumes deals recurring damage, hard to survive
Essence of Ether ideal for non-lethal captures
Malice useful for disabling vision-dependent enemies
Area effect makes it dangerous to use near allies
Can be deployed by trap mechanisms

srdReference.quote: Poisonous powders and gases take effect when inhaled. Blowing the powder or releasing the gas subjects creatures in a 5-foot Cube to its effect. The resulting cloud dissipates immediately afterward. Holding one's breath is ineffective against inhaled poisons, as they affect nasal membranes, tear ducts, and other parts of the body.

examples: Burnt Othur Fumes released from trap in narrow corridor
Essence of Ether used to anesthetize surgery patient or kidnap victim
Malice deployed against archers or spellcasters to blind them
Gas trap triggered by pressure plate in dungeon
